comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: interesting: Although he was a decent clarinetist and saxophonist, Mezz Mezzrow is remembered today primarily for his autobiography "Really the Blues", and for rejecting White society and embracing African-American culture, to the extent that he actually believed that he was Black www.redhotjazz.com/mezz.html

comment.author: 11435178@N03
comment._content: Yes, that book is a wonderful read! Mezz was the only guy who ever tried to "pass" for black.

comment.author: 8570186@N06
11435178@N03
comment._content: Have you ever read "Really the Blues?" You'd know what we mean.

comment.author: 84575910@N06
comment._content: ... now now folks - it was, as i recall, the mez, who aside from harry (the hipster) gibson who "gauged the age, so to speak.
